meanings.definition: A person or thing that induces.
meanings.sent1: The inducer of laughter at the party was the clown.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the inducer of knowledge in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The inducer of chaos in the kitchen was the mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the inducer of happiness in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The inducer of fear in the haunted house was the ghostly figure.

meanings.definition: A substance that initiates or accelerates a particular process or reaction.
meanings.sent1: The sugar acted as an inducer in the fermentation process.
meanings.sent2: The catalyst was the inducer of the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent3: The spicy sauce was the inducer of excitement in the bland dish.
meanings.sent4: His words were the inducer of change in her perspective.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock was the inducer of waking up early in the morning.
